alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 5:03AM AKST until December 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain mixed with snow occasionally. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Highest snow amounts from Sterling east. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 9 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Expect reductions in visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin to overspread the Western Kenai Peninsula Monday morning. However, due to warm air already in place above the surface, a mix of snow and freezing rain especially for places such as Kenai and Soldotna south to Ninilchik is possible. For Homer, enough warm air is expected to move overhead and at the surface to keep precipitation mainly in the form of rain. Precipitation will gradually taper off from west to east Monday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
